title: Simple circuits - charge flow in bulbs A and-or B

content.question: A circuit is created with a battery, two light bulbs, and an open switch, as shown in the figure. Which of the following statements is correct about charge flowing in the circuit?

choices.label: Charge will flow through bulb <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> but not through bulb <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

Charge will flow through bulb <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> but not through bulb <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.
Charge will flow through both bulbs.
No charge will flow through either bulb.

content.answer: No charge will flow through either bulb.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
